content.question: A <math alttext="3 kilogram" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>3</mn><mo> </mo><mi>kg</mi></math> object is moving along a straight, horizontal track at a constant speed of <math alttext="4 meters per second" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>4</mn><mo> </mo><mtext>m/s</mtext></math> for <math alttext="5" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>5</mn></math> seconds. The linear momentum of the object is most nearly

choices.label: <math alttext="12 kilogram meters per second" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>12</mn><mo> </mo><mtext>kg</mtext><mo>·</mo><mtext>m/s</mtext></math>
<math alttext="20 kilogram meters per second" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>20</mn><mo> </mo><mtext>kg</mtext><mo>·</mo><mtext>m/s</mtext></math>
<math alttext="24 kilogram meters per second" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>24</mn><mo> </mo><mtext>kg</mtext><mo>·</mo><mtext>m/s</mtext></math>
<math alttext="30 kilogram meters per second" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>30</mn><mo> </mo><mtext>kg</mtext><mo>·</mo><mtext>m/s</mtext></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="12 kilogram meters per second" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>12</mn><mo> </mo><mtext>kg</mtext><mo>·</mo><mtext>m/s</mtext></math>

skill.text: 2.B: Calculate or estimate an unknown quantity with units from known quantities, by selecting and following a logical computational pathway.
